headline: Oven Baked Chicken Teriyaki
description: Chicken is baked in a simple homemade teriyaki sauce for a quick and easy weeknight dinner.

video.description: Simple, saucy teriyaki chicken you bake in the oven.
video.name: Oven Baked Chicken Teriyaki

name: Oven Baked Chicken Teriyaki

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).

Whisk cornstarch and water together in a small bowl until dissolved; set aside. Combine soy sauce, sugar, mirin, ginger, garlic, and red pepper flakes together in a saucepan over medium heat until the mixture starts to simmer. Slowly whisk in cornstarch mixture. Bring to a boil; reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer until thickened, stirring often, about 10 minutes.
Pat chicken dry with paper towels; arrange in a baking dish. Pour sauce over chicken breasts, coating all sides.

Bake chicken breasts in the preheated oven until no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, 25 to 30 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (75 degrees C).

review.reviewBody: Very good.

This was delicious! I cut the sauce recipe in half because I was only cooking for two. I used Sherry cooking wine instead of the mirin, because I had no idea what it is and didn't have it. The Sherry was suggested by another reviewer. I also used powdered ginger (didn't have fresh). Since I cut the recipe in half, I used about 3/4 tsp. Easy to prep and cooks in 30-35 minutes. Perfect! Thank you!
I made this and family loved it.

This was delicious. I had already marinated my chicken overnight in a soy sauce/white wine/oil/ginger marinade, which probably helped. I like being able to bake this in the oven, since my stove top was occupied with other projects at the time! I omitted the red pepper since we are wimps, and used turbinado sugar instead of white because that's what I had. There was lovely caramelization around the edges of the pan, yes black in a few places but it didn't taste burnt. My only complaint was that I felt 2 TBS of cornstarch was too much. I like the sauce to cling to the chicken, but I also like to be able to pour it over my veggies and this was a bit thick. Thanks for sharing!

This chicken recipe is amazing. I cut down some of the soy sauce (so not too salty). I didn’t have the wine that the recipe called for; so I used rice vinegar and a added a little brown sugar to cut the sour. Other then that, I followed the recipe. It was delicious with rice and stir fried veggies.

This was really good teriyaki chicken. I would only say that if I were to make it again I would either add like a cup of water to it or doubly make sure to have low sodium soy sauce. Also, halve the ginger because it was more than a little over powering.

This was horribly, horribly salty even with the low sodium soy sauce! I followed the directions explicitly. Perhaps cut the soy sauce in half or more with possibly low sodium chicken broth or dilute with plain old water...do not make this as directed, so salty almost inedible.

I am not a huge soy sauce fan, but figured I would give it a try anyway. I'd definitely make it again, doing less of the soy sauce and substituting it with something different that makes it less strong. I cut the chicken into cubes, and loved that.
I followed it to a t. It was easy and flavorful.

Substituted garlic and ginger powder,as I hadn’t any fresh in my fridge. Is.so used low sodium soy and only 1/4 cup of brown sugar. Everyone devoured it. Makes a great sauce for rice or vegetable topping too!

I poured this sauce over an entire (10) pack of thighs , multiple times and then stir fried a ton of our favorite veggies and then chop the chicken up and add back in when ready to eat. It's a delicious little sauce and puts a really nice glaze on the chicken by the time it's done backing.
just made this! such a delicious sauce!

The sauce was great. I’d keep this recipe just for that and use it on other meats or other cuts of chicken as well. It didn’t take 10 minutes for my sauce to thicken though. Maybe more like 5. It was definitely hard to scrape my baking dish after this was in the oven, but the flavor of the sauce was really enjoyable.

This homemade teriyaki sauce is the best we have ever had. It was very simple to make and the fresh ginger made all the difference. Will definitely make again. Only suggestion would be to cut the chicken into small bite sizes and then cook. That way the chicken gets more of the sauce in each bite.
great recipe. I did the sauce in a pan and replace the chicken by fried tofu. it was amazingly good,

Can't wait to try this again. Even my picky 19yo son said it was "pretty good." High praise for a millennial. Honestly, the made-from-scratch teriyaki marinade and sauce was heavenly. I used extra ginger and garlic. The baking made for a creamy fall-off-the-bone tenderness. This will be a go-to meal for our family.
delicious! went well with brown rice and broccoli
I thought it was very good and easy! I want to make it again with double the sauce for over rice. Yum
Great recipe! I made it on the stove with green beans added in, served over riced cauliflower
I double the recipe and use chicken breast cut into bite size pieces. My family loves this dinner. I serve it with fried rice.
I followed the recipe exactly and it was so salty we could not eat it, and I used the low sodium variety!

My family loves this recipe, including all the children! It's so easy to make and you can easily add veggies and toss with the teriyaki sauce, if you like. Sometimes I double the sauce to make sure we have enough to to around. The only thing different I do is use 1 tsp dried ginger in place of the fresh, and sherry instead of the mirin wine.
Really good flavor. The family liked it so that’s a plus! Fairly easy to make. I plan to make it again.
This sauce is really thick and sticky and says on the chicken when baking. I used boneless thighs and baked at 400 degrees for about 25-30 minutes. I like this recipe a lot.
Instead of Mirin, I sweetened some crisp white wine. The sauce was good and I think tomorrow the chicken have a very good flavor through and through.
Loved it!
Loved it!
This was a big hit at my family dinner! I would totally make it again!

I made this for my Sweetie who thinks he's the teriyaki authority. He loved it! I did tweak some, as I always do, but the base was a perfect jumping off point. He told me to keep thi s one scrounge because he wants to try it on pork and fish, too.
Very simple to make. Delicious. Only thing I would add is some Chinese vegetables.

LOVED LOVED LOVED LOVED LOVED LOVED this recipe, if you don't you didn't make it right! It is the BEST Teriyaki Chicken ever! We didn't have Mirin sauce so we subbed with chicken broth and it was perfect! Also, we just had dried ginger and it was fine!
With the white rice I sprinkled it with 5 Chinese spice so was the perfect match to the Teriyaki Chicken! Side salad with avo we sprinkled on Dill and Paprika was great!
We had THE PERFECT DINNER, we will have soon again!
I don't keep japanese wine. So I used bourbon. Hey it was good. I'll make it again. We had rice last nite so we served this with smashed taters. thank you.
Yes, used thighs instead, good stuff.

Very nice recipe. Everyone liked it. I changed it slightly but would be great as is. Here is what I did differently. I used sherry wine instead of the one called for. I cut the chicken into large chunks and cooked them in the pan with the sauce for about 15-20 minutes stirring occasionally. I also covered the pan for a couple minutes. Oh and I added a package of sliced mushrooms. Delicious served with jasmine rice with peas and carrots cooked into the rice. Salad on the side.
Edit: I made this again but with skinless, boneless legs and instead of cutting them into pieces I just sautéed them in a little olive oil first, then added the sauce to the pan and cooked for a few more minutes. I made the mistake of adding salt and pepper to the meat before sautéing and the dish was too salty. Despite that, it was really good over rice.
Very good and so easy. Family raved of the chicken

Very easy recipe to follow and it turned out delicious! I ended up putting some of the sesame sauce aside and stir fried vegetables and low mien in it. My only advice is to make sure the sauce simmers long enough to thicken up! My sauce ended up being a little watery than I expected but it still tasted great nonetheless.

Partially cooked the chicken breast on the griddle on high to seal in the juices, then diced and placed in baking dish covering with the sauce, covered the dish with parchment paper (I don't use aluminum foil) and finished cooking in the oven. I doubled all the ingredients for the sauce, except only used 1/4 cup of sugar and 1/2 teaspoon of freshly grated ginger. Served with jasmine rice, steamed brocolli, hot jasmine tea, and purchased lomein from the local Chinese restaurant. This was a big hit starting with husband all the way down to the 14 year old. Taste so authentic, it was good!

Partially cooked the chicken breast on the griddle on high to seal in the juices, then diced and placed in baking dish covering with the sauce, covered the dish with parchment paper (I don't use aluminum foil) and finished cooking in the oven. I doubled all the ingredients for the sauce, except only used 1/4 cup of sugar and 1/2 teaspoon of freshly grated ginger. Served with jasmine rice, steamed brocolli, hot jasmine tea, and purchased lomein from the local Chinese restaurant. This was a big hit starting with husband all the way down to the 14 year old. Taste so authentic, it was good!
It was fair to middling!!! Probably won't make again.
Perfect mix for chicken teriyaki. I LOVE it.

Great recipe, I did it a little differently and deboned some thighs, wrapped the skin around the thighs and fried them in peanut oil to get a nice crunchy skin. When I ladled the amazing teriyaki sauce on them, it stuck like glue and was off the chain..thank you, thank you...
Used brown sugar instead of white also used white wine instead of mirin, very easy to make and tasted really good.
This dish as insanely salty. I used reduced sodium soy sauce and still couldn't eat it. It seems like it needs something to cut the saltiness of the soy sauce.
The flavor was mellow and subtle but very good. It would be better if marinaded for a day, in my opinion.

Great recipe and the sauce came out great! I will do this again. Also I didn't use the oven just cooked the chicken separately and then added the sauce. Simmered for ten minutes and played. Next time will add veggies and onions to provide a pop of color. Overall great recipe

This was soooo scrumptious. The only substitutions I made were to use 1 t. powdered ginger instead of fresh and sherry instead of mirin. OMG, it was so delicious. I was thinking this marinade would be great on salmon and on steak tips, too so may try those. If you like teriyaki flavor, try this!

Esta receta me encanta y gracias porque la verdad queria saber como se hace esta receta, ojala me puedan decir como se hace la salsa aridulce que se le pone a los nuguet de pollo.
Saludos
OMG!! Awesome chicken dish, will differently make this again and again??

This was pretty good. I stuck to the recipe (except I used brown sugar instead of white). I also browned the chicken in an ovenproof skillet before adding the teriyaki sauce and then popped the whole thing in the oven - for about 10 minutes at 350°F. It was tender and flavourful. One thing I would suggest is to use a good quality soy sauce, it makes up the bulk of the sauce so the better the soy sauce, the better the result.

I will make it again, but will cut down on the amount of sauce.
It was very good but I would like a little less of it.
It was good, and my family liked it. It was a bit salty for my taste (but I don't like salt), but my husband loved it. Will make again for sure.

This creates the perfect Teriyaki sauce! My family loves it. I cut up chicken in small pieces and fry in a wok with coconut oil. I then remove the chicken and fry up some veggies. I remove those and then make the sauce in the same pan. I used a little less ginger and I used dried ginger. Also didn't have mirin so I used white wine mixed with a bit of sugar. After sauce had thickened I added back in the chicken and veggies. Served over white rice for my husband and riced cauliflower for me! Delicious!

This is delicious!! I used ground rather than fresh garlic, but it was still incredible. Most of the way through making the sauce, I realized I grabbed chicken thighs instead of breasts at the store! I cooked for 30 minutes with them completely covered by the sauce and I couldn't be happier. Going to try this on salmon sometime as someone else suggested.
I made the recipe as is, way too sweet for my taste. If i ever make again i would halve the sugar!!!!
This was yummy and got a big thumbs up from the family. We agreed that adding some vegetables to the sauce would be good. Will try that next time.
No Changes, was delicious just the way it was. YES, recommend
Would be better on the BBQ where it can be basted more frequently to build up a thick, sticky sauce. Don't skimp on the red pepper flakes.

Delicious! I made as per the recipe with the following exceptions: I used Gewürztraminer in place of Mirin and I diced the chicken breast before mixing with the sauce and baking. I covered the casserole dish for the first 20 minutes and had it uncovered for the rest of the baking time. I will try leaving it uncovered next time. I agree with the previous reviewers, definitely use low-sodium ingredients.
This dish is fantastic! There were no leftovers. However, I highly recommend using low-sodium soy sauce only. Otherwise, It will be a bit salty.

My family loved this chicken. I made it on the stovetop with boneless skinless chicken thighs. I drained the fat and browned the chicken well before turning off the heat and adding the sauce. I will probably serve this with a fried rice next time and some quickly cooked zucchini and sprouts.
Added sautéed onion and some red pepper flakes

Perfect! Just as good as eating out! I will use this as my to to Teriyaki sauce in the future. I did not have the mirin, so I used a white wine I had in the fridge. The sauce is delicious. I am serving it with steamed vegetables over short grain brown rice.
Happy happy cook!
I won't make again, as the flavor was far too strong.
Made no changes it was delicious and so easy to follow recipe

I made the recipe exactly as directed except that I did not have LOW SODIUM soy sauce. So mine was VERY salty. Anyway, I still loved the recipe and served mine with white rice and chopped broccoli which I steamed with the rice as it cooked. It is so easy to do and gréât for a day when you don't really have time to cook. I would make this again and again. I think the leftover chicken will also be gréât on a salad with a bunch of crispy vegetables and maybe even some pineapple. By the way, the recipe makes a lot of sauce. (Oh, I iforgot I did not have any mirin so I used sherry. It was good anyway !!!) And one last thing. The sauce has a lot of sugar in it so keep an eye on it so that it does not burn in the 400 degree oven.
I always have to adjust for my colitis, diabetes, and arthritis. As such it was pretty good.

I actually used Marsala wine as I didn't have what the recipe called for. This was AMAZING!- all my kids had seconds 
Would decrease the ginger a little bit next time.
Whole family loved it. I would add sesame seeds to it next time though.
My husband and my son loved this meal. Both of them gave thumbs up for the recipe.
Awesome dish...
It was a salty because I forgot to use low sodium so sauce. But it was very delish!
Awsome
Did not have mirin, used sherry and ground not fresh ginger. So delicious served with green beans and rice. Will be making this again! Just the right amount of sweet with a kick.
We really enjoyed this chicken. Easy and good flavor. Will be adding to our menu rotation.
Excellent did in a pan and added steamable Asian veggie mix at the end 5 minutes before I served. Flavor was amazing.
it was ok. don't know what I was expecting but I did use the gravy on stir fry a couple nights later which was good.
Wife and I enjoyed it last night. Would make again. Used four chicken breasts instead of 12 thighs but did not alter the amount of Teriyaki. I might use less teriyaki next time.

I cut the chicken into small chunks then browned it in a skillet. Then I put it into a baking dish and poured the sauce over it. I served it with the baked rice. I only put 1/4 of the ginger that was recommended in the recipe and 1/4 of the red pepper flakes. Next time I will add a little more pepper flakes, but I will keep the same amount of ginger. It was delish!! My family loved it also!!!
I think it would be fine to cook in a covered skillet on top of the stove, but since I was making the baked rice, I went ahead and put it in the oven.
No and it's really a good recipe.

Excellent. Followed recipe exactly which I always do first time out. The thighs were done after 50 minutes cook time. Tastey and moist. I only cooked 6 thighs since there are only two of us but I did make the full amount of sauce and had about half left over. Will definitely make it again.
Awesome recipe. Great flavor. Will definitely make this one again.
It was unbelievably delicious and very easy to make! It will definitely be made again for family.
The only change I made was that I cut the recipe in half because it was only for myself and my husband. This was THE best teriyaki recipe that I have ever tried!!

I have been making chicken teriyaki for years with a different recipe.. It has always been good. But this is by far the best chicken teriyaki chicken I have ever made. My husband went nuts. My 92 year old father who has no tastebuds left also loved it. My 25 year old son who is home temporarily between Army assignments referred to this sauce as liquid gold. It was perfect. Using the low sodium soy sauce gave it such flavor. My only change to the whole thing was using turbanadi sugar, I had no white. This one is a keeper folks. Serve it with rice and I made the Winter Fruit Salad from this site.
I followed the recipe exactly. Not only was it way too much ginger, (that's 1 tsp per chicken breast!), it was also too salty. I won't be making this again.
Made this just as told and it was GREAT!! I used the sauce over chicken legs and thighs and it was really good. Next I will do the chicken breasts next week. Thanks
This was amazing just as it is!!! Yummy!!!
It was very good, but a little salty.
Sauce was far too salty, even with low sodium soy sauce. At 400 degrees, the chicken was burned. If I were to make this again, I would use half soy sauce and half water to cut the salt.
Love love love this recipe! I used rice vinegar in place of the mirim wine because the store didn't have it. I also used thighs because that's what I had on hand. Can't wait to make it again!
Excellent! I added a layer of pineapple chunks on the bottom of the baking dish and the rest of the chunks over the top of the syrup on chicken. Oven baked.
Everyone thought this dish was really good. I would add stir fry veggies as well to make it a more well rounded meal
Very good, my family loved it!
Very good recipe. I just kills me that people change the recipe and then complain that it doesn't taste good. DONT CHANGE TBS RECIPE !!!!
The dish is very good. I suggest you use low sodium soy sauce.

I made this exactly as described and it was excellent! For the record though, this is pretty much "General Tso's Chicken". I usually prepare this dish on the stove top, with Sun-Bird General Tso's Chicken Seasoning Mix, which does not require baking. However, this (baking) method seems to coat the chicken better so that it tastes more like what you expect to get at a good Chinese restaurant. Serve it over white rice with a little butter and Garam Masala mixed in. Or, if you are adventurous, skip the Garam and go with crushed red pepper. Also, a little chopped up broccoli, peppers (mild or hot), or minced butternut squash (or all three!) added to the sauce will give it an extra oomph!
A very easy dish that turned out wonderfully! I will often serve this over white rice or with homemade fried rice and it's been a hit in our household.
The whole family LOVED it and begged me to make it again.
Simply delicious. This recipe makes it into the meal rotation. I highly recommend it!
